basis: User expresses clear commitment to follow the suggested routine (water 200ml, optional split into 100ml, 60-second focus) and explicitly plans to try again tomorrow, indicating alignment with the coach's guidance.
cognitive_dissonance: User experiences ongoing anxiety around meals while attempting to maintain a small, actionable routine; internal tension between wanting progress and fear of failure or discomfort.
negative_thought_patterns: Meal-related anxiety; fear that meals will be overwhelming; possible perfectionistic thoughts about sticking to a plan without slipping.
emotional_triggers: Food-related anxiety, heat/physical discomfort, need for control, anticipation of meal times, desire for supportive feedback.
coaching_notes: Maintain and reinforce concrete, bite-sized actions; acknowledge progress and normalizing anxiety. Continue offering simple, repeatable routines and contingency options for when anxiety spikes. Consider adding brief coping strategies (e.g., short diaphragmatic breaths, optional micro-breaks) and celebrate small wins to sustain motivation.
